subject: Parameterized test does not play well with Eclipse TestRunner UI

Hi -

I'm using @RunWith(org.junit.runners.Parameterized.class) to have
par=
ameterized tests.

Tests run (and fail) fine. but when the error is reporte=
d it is
reported as myTestMethodName[0] or myTestMethodName[1] (according t=
o
which parameter was used.

This is fine for display, but unfortunately wh=
en Eclipse wants to find
the test, it is using this name and so if you doub=
le click on a
success/failure, eclipse will complain with "Can't find metho=
d
'myTestMethodName[0]' opening test class instead".

It's not that importa=
nt - I have been living with this for about a
year (!), but finally wondere=
d hey - let's ask around if there's an
obvious workaround (a way to overide=
 the test name in the test) or a
way to fix this... I'd rather not patch my=
 local junit.

(No mention of this in the forums or elsewhere AFAIK).

than=
ks 

Tim
